TIME.comments: This is the start of time bin.

CHLF.long_name: Mean of mass_concentration_of_inferred_chlorophyll_from_relative_fluorescence_units_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CHLF_max.long_name: Maximum mass_concentration_of_inferred_chlorophyll_from_relative_fluorescence_units_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CHLF_min.long_name: Minimum mass_concentration_of_inferred_chlorophyll_from_relative_fluorescence_units_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CHLF_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

CHLF_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of mass_concentration_of_inferred_chlorophyll_from_relative_fluorescence_units_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CNDC.long_name: Mean of sea_water_electrical_conductivity values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CNDC_max.long_name: Maximum sea_water_electrical_conductivity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CNDC_min.long_name: Minimum sea_water_electrical_conductivity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

CNDC_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

CNDC_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea_water_electrical_conductivity in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DENS.comment: density computed from Temperature, Salinity and Pressure with the CSIRO SeaWater library (EOS-80) v1.1.
DENS.long_name: Mean of sea_water_density values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DENS_max.long_name: Maximum sea_water_density value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DENS_min.long_name: Minimum sea_water_density value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DENS_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DENS_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea_water_density in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DEPTH.comment: depthPP: Depth computed using the Gibbs-SeaWater toolbox (TEOS-10) v3.02 from latitude and relative pressure measurements (calibration offset usually performed to balance current atmospheric pressure and acute sensor precision at a deployed depth).
DEPTH.long_name: Mean of actual depth values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DEPTH_max.long_name: Maximum actual depth value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DEPTH_min.long_name: Minimum actual depth value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DEPTH_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DEPTH_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of actual depth in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_1.comment: Originally expressed in mmol/m3, 1l = 0.001m3 was assumed.
DOX1_1.long_name: Mean of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_1_max.long_name: Maximum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_1_min.long_name: Minimum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_1_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DOX1_1_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_2.comment: Originally expressed in ml/l, 1ml/l = 44.660umol/l was assumed.
DOX1_2.long_name: Mean of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_2_max.long_name: Maximum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_2_min.long_name: Minimum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_2_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DOX1_2_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_3.comment: Originally expressed in mg/l, O2 density = 1.429kg/m3 and 1ml/l = 44.660umol/l were assumed.
DOX1_3.long_name: Mean of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_3_max.long_name: Maximum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_3_min.long_name: Minimum mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX1_3_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DOX1_3_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX2.comment: Originally expressed in mmol/m3, using density computed from Temperature, Salinity and Pressure with the CSIRO SeaWater library (EOS-80) v1.1.
DOX2.long_name: Mean of moles_of_oxygen_per_unit_mass_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX2_max.long_name: Maximum moles_of_oxygen_per_unit_mass_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX2_min.long_name: Minimum moles_of_oxygen_per_unit_mass_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

DOX2_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

DOX2_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of moles_of_oxygen_per_unit_mass_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

FLU2.comment: fluorescence_in_sea_water digital count. To convert to chlorophyll concentration CHL(ug/l) = Scale_Factor X (Raw_Counts - Dark_Counts)
FLU2.long_name: Mean of fluorescence_in_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

FLU2_max.long_name: Maximum fluorescence_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

FLU2_min.long_name: Minimum fluorescence_in_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

FLU2_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

FLU2_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of fluorescence_in_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PRES_REL.long_name: Mean of sea_water_pressure_due_to_sea_water values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PRES_REL_max.long_name: Maximum sea_water_pressure_due_to_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PRES_REL_min.long_name: Minimum sea_water_pressure_due_to_sea_water value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PRES_REL_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

PRES_REL_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea_water_pressure_due_to_sea_water in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PSAL.long_name: Mean of sea_water_salinity values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PSAL_max.long_name: Maximum sea_water_salinity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PSAL_min.long_name: Minimum sea_water_salinity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

PSAL_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

PSAL_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea_water_salinity in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TEMP.long_name: Mean of sea_water_temperature values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TEMP_max.long_name: Maximum sea_water_temperature value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TEMP_min.long_name: Minimum sea_water_temperature value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TEMP_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

TEMP_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea_water_temperature in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB.long_name: Mean of turbidity values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_RAW_COUNT.comments: turbidity digital count. To convert to concentration NTU = Scale_Factor X (Raw_Counts - Dark_Counts)
TURB_RAW_COUNT.long_name: Mean of turbidity digital count values in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_RAW_COUNT_max.long_name: Maximum turbidity digital count value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_RAW_COUNT_min.long_name: Minimum turbidity digital count value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_RAW_COUNT_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

TURB_RAW_COUNT_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of turbidity digital count in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_max.long_name: Maximum turbidity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_min.long_name: Minimum turbidity value in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

TURB_num_obs.long_name: Number of observations in time bin included in time bin average

TURB_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of turbidity in time bin, after rejection of flagged data

Total_num_obs.long_name: total number of observations in the time bins including flagged observations

aws_opendata_registry.Name: Satellite - Ocean Colour - Lucinda Jetty Coastal Observatory
aws_opendata_registry.Description:
The Lucinda Jetty Coastal Observatory (LJCO) is located on the end of the 5.8 km long Lucinda Jetty (18.52 S, 146.39 E) in the coastal waters of the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area close to the Herbert River Estuary and the Hinchinbrook Channel in Queensland.

The observatory acquires continuous above and in-water optical measurements with the objective to support satellite ocean colour validation and algorithm development. Data collection and delivery was interrupted in 2011 with tropical cyclone Yasi.  Currently, LJCO is the only southern-hemisphere ocean colour validation site integrated into NASA’s AERONET-OC global network of ground-based radiometers and one of a few sites globally that combines the acquisition of both atmospheric and in-water optical measurements. 

Mounted instruments on the LJCO included:
- Met Station (Vaisala WXT520)
- Above-water radiometry
--- CIMEL SeaPRISM
--- Satlantic HyperOCR
--- DALEC instrument (added in mid-2016 for continuous hyper-spectral radiometric measurements)
-Instrument telemetry
--- Power supply
--- UPS
--- NextG Router
--- WETLabs DAPCS
--- PC controller
--- Automated winch
- Underwater optics
--- WETLabs WQM
--- WETLabs Eco Triplet
--- WETLabs ac-s
--- WETLabs BB9
- Campbell Scientific submersible pressure transducer

The above-water measurements collected at LJCO compromise of multi-spectral water-leaving radiance and atmospheric observations for retrieving aerosol optical properties using an autonomous CIMEL SeaPRISM radiometer, in addition to hyper-spectral down-welling radiance
measurements using the a Satlantic Hyper-OCR. In mid 2016 continuous hyper-spectral radiometric measurements were added using the DALEC instrument.

The in-water optical measurements consist of conductivity, temperature, pressure, dissolved oxygen, chlorophyll fluorescence and turbidity using a WETLabs WQM, coloured dissolved organic matter (CDOM) fluorescence using a WETLabs EcoTriplet, as well as particulate and dissolved spectral absorption and attenuation coefficients using a WETLabs AC-S. Further, total backscattering coefficients are measured using a WETLabs BB9 radiometer. 

Additional meteorological and sea state measurements are continuously recorded such as barometric pressure, relative humidity, air  emperature, wind speed and direction using a Vaisala WXT520 weather transmitter. Wave height and water temperature are measured with a Campbell Scientific submersible pressure transducer that is used to keep the caged in-water optical instruments at a constant depth.

All data streams are processed in delayed-mode with automatic quality control applied and made publicly available through the AODN portal; and the data presented here is the daily in-water generated products.

Resources.Description: Cloud Optimised AODN dataset of IMOS - SRS Satellite Ocean Colour Sub-Facility - Lucinda Jetty Coastal Observatory (LJCO)
